metadata.synopsis: Blue-collar buddies (Sidney Poitier, Bill Cosby) search the underworld for a winning lottery ticket lost in a nightclub holdup.

reviews: We should continue to demand, expect, and fight for much more from our movies. But we should never let ourselves be content with yesterday's warmed up left-overs. And, unfortunately, that's just what Uptown Saturday Night is.
I have nothing but good feelings about the movie.
Very dated humor with youngish Cosby and Poitier...who directs OK.
...harmless enough, flimsy and almost forgettable entertainment but easy going down.
An uproarious urban comedy that's sure to cater to the crowd. Poitier and Cosby make for a riotous duo in this flipppant farce.
Great buddy chemistry between Cosby and Poitier make this a 70's classic.
